repnme.cdata!:
China - Second Tianjin Urban Development
            and Environment Project and Chongqing Small Cities
            Infrastructure Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Tianjin Urban
            Development and Environment Project for China were as
            follows: outcome was moderately unsatisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was negligible or low, Bank performance
            was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Ratings for the Chongqing Small
            Cities Infrastructure Improvement Project for China were as
            follows: outcome was moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was significant, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            great care is needed in project preparation and appraisal to
            ensure that all interventions are feasible. A well-phrased
            and clearly defined project development objective statement
            and a comprehensive monitoring and evaluation (M and E)
            framework is a key step towards a results-focused Bank
            operation. By continuing to tailor its services and
            instruments to the more localized needs and capacity of the
            Borrower, the Bank can maintain the effectiveness of its
            support. While the Bank's engagement has supported the
            development in China, its prolonged internal decision-making
            processes may decrease its competitiveness in helping
            address fast-paced changes.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Chongqing Small Cities
            Infrastructure Improvement Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Chongqing Small
            Cities Infrastructure Improvement Project for China is to
            support emerging small cities to improve the efficiency and
            effectiveness of infrastructure service delivery, to
            accommodate the rapid urban growth. The change is to adjust
            the loan proceeds among items of each categories, namely to
            re-allocate all the undisbursed amount under civil work
            category which from 1-A to 1-G, the goods category of 2-B,
            and category of consulting service category of 3-B and 3-F,
            as well as category 5 (unallocated) to the newly created
            item 1-H of works - pooled works for all parts of the
            project. The purpose of such re-allocation is to facilitate
            the reimbursement process for remaining works under the project.

            Infrastructure Improvement Project : restructuring (Vol. 2)
